node.title: Appeals Court Blocks COVID Vaccine Mandates for Businesses Larger Than 100 Employees
node.alt: A photo of a syringe being filled with the COVID-19 vaccine.
node.description: "This is a win for Utahns," the governor of Utah said.
node.content:
["The U.S. 5th Circuit Court of Appeals sided with Utah on Friday and blocked President Joe Biden's vaccine mandate for businesses with over 100 employees.", "The court issued a stay on enforcement of the mandate pending further judicial review. It also stated that the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) was not to take any steps to \"implement or enforce the mandate\" until a further decision was made.", "Utah was joined in the lawsuit by South Carolina, Mississippi and Texas.", "\"The mandate threatens to substantially burden the liberty interests of reluctant individual recipients put to a choice between their job(s) and their jab(s),\" Judge Kurt Engelhardt wrote in a court filing.", "", "
A photo of a syringe being filled with the COVID-19 vaccine.
", "\"We're encouraged by the court's recognition that the OSHA rule exceeds their authority with this mandate. This is a win for Utahns,\" Utah Governor Spencer J. Cox said in a statement.", "This ruling does not have any effect, however, on businesses that have implemented their own vaccine mandates.", "This is a breaking news story and will be updated with additional information. "]
